Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Amulet
Description: Small amulet with two differently treated surfaces: the first one is flat while the second depicts, in low relief, a masculine deity wearing the atef-crown. The figure appears to be seated, with its hands on his knees, on a small square pedestal. There are two suspension holes: one at the base of the crown and the other at the level of the feetl.
